intro: Astronia pileolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom during the warmer months. Astronia pileolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
